decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game using Ad Nauseam as the main enabler. The deck aims to use cards like Spoils of the Vault and Serum Visions to set up the combo, while also utilizing cards like Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to buy time and protect yourself until you can go off. Thassa's Oracle is used as the win condition in combination with the ability to draw your entire library with Ad Nauseam to ensure victory. The deck is designed for fast and explosive wins in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck aims to assemble a powerful board state quickly by utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate extra mana. The key concept is to ramp up quickly with cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer, eventually using Primeval Titan to search for lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage and life gain.

The deck revolves around ramping up mana quickly using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Arboreal Grazer, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, to eventually cast big creatures like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes various lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead to generate additional value. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces to cheat out powerful threats and overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Through the Breach and Fierce Empath to search for and play key creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. The deck includes cards that provide synergy and support for the Human tribe, such as Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Benalish Marshal. Aether Vial can help get creatures onto the battlefield quickly, while cards like Reflector Mage and Unsettled Mariner provide disruptive elements to control the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and recursion to the deck.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to play powerful threats such as Glorybringer and Inferno Titan. It also disrupts opponents' mana bases with Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon. The deck aims to control the game with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant, while generating card advantage with Seasoned Pyromancer. Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Klothys, God of Destiny provide additional value and disruption. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disrupt their game plan to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal Infect damage to the opponent, utilizing a combination of creature pump spells, protection spells, and cards that provide additional buffs to creatures with Infect. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent by leveraging the Infect mechanic, which allows players to win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to an opponent instead of traditional damage. By using a variety of pump spells, protection spells, and efficient creatures with Infect, this deck is able to quickly take down opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Jund Aggro deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck also has versatile removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the field. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six provide additional value and card advantage, while also helping to control the board. The deck's manabase is designed to support its aggressive game plan while also providing access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly through aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf while disrupting their hand and board with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Liliana of the Veil. By combining efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command with powerful threats, the deck looks to control the game early on and close it out before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The mana base is designed to support the deck's curve while also allowing for consistent access to all the necessary colors.

This deck aims to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, hand disruption with Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, and versatile threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf. Support cards like Mishra's Bauble and Wrenn and Six provide card advantage and consistency, while cards like Seal of Fire and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger apply pressure and close out games quickly. The goal is to establish early dominance and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly gain life using cards like Martyr of Sands and Lone Missionary, while also putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Serra Ascendant and Squadron Hawk. The deck is also designed to control the opponent's lands with cards like Field of Ruin and Ghost Quarter. The ultimate goal is to outlast the opponent by gaining enough life to survive, while also overwhelming them with a swarm of creatures powered up by Force of Virtue.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Merfolk tribal strategy. By utilizing synergies between Merfolk creatures and tribal Lords, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. Key cards such as Lord of Atlantis, Master of the Pearl Trident, and Aether Vial allow for efficient pumps and plays, while disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Merfolk Trickster help control the board. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion for the deck.

This deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's hand and board while generating a constant stream of evasive threats. Utilizing a mix of removal, hand disruption, and planeswalkers, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence with cards like Bitterblossom and Lingering Souls. The equipment package adds additional power and protection to the deck's threats, allowing it to close out games quickly once it has gained control. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering key threats and generating card advantage.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressively and utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to chip away at the opponent's life total, while also having access to direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, this deck aims to win quickly before the opponent can stabilize. With efficient card draw options like Light Up the Stage and powerful finishers like Bedlam Reveler, this deck aims to maintain pressure and close out the game as soon as possible.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature and burn spells. The deck is designed to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Lava Spike to put pressure on the opponent. Runaway Steam-Kin and Bedlam Reveler provide additional threats and card advantage, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart offer direct damage to close out games. The deck also includes draw spells like Light Up the Stage and Manamorphose to maintain momentum and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to consistently hit land drops and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation. It also utilizes powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to close out the game. The inclusion of Nexus of Fate allows the deck to take extra turns and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful interactions.

The key focus of this deck is to gain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful win conditions. By utilizing cards like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Force of Negation, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling its own win conditions such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Primeval Titan, and Field of the Dead. With access to powerful card advantage engines like Fact or Fiction and Wrenn and Six, the deck is able to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to use a combination of mill cards and control elements to quickly deplete the opponent's library and win the game by emptying their deck. Key cards include Glimpse the Unthinkable, Archive Trap, and Mesmeric Orb to accelerate the milling process, while cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Drown in the Loch provide protection and disruption. The deck aims to outpace the opponent's ability to draw cards, ultimately leading to victory through mill rather than traditional combat damage.

The primary strategy of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes various tools for finding the UrzaTron lands, such as Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, and ways to control the board, such as Oblivion Stone and Karn, the Great Creator.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and card advantage, while utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler to dominate the battlefield. It also aims to stall the game with removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, and eventually win the game with finishers like Entreat the Angels and God-Eternal Kefnet. The deck also includes a toolbox of utility lands like Mystic Sanctuary and Field of Ruin to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, efficient creatures and powerful synergies. By quickly deploying low-cost creatures and using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Ranger-Captain of Eos to maximize their potential, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence. Cards like Giver of Runes and Isamaru, Hound of Konda help protect key creatures, while also utilizing artifacts like Mox Amber to accelerate the deck's game plan. The deck also includes disruption spells like On Thin Ice to control the opponent's board and tempo.
